title: Improve Your Online Visibility
text:
1 Welcome
This workshop will take you through setting up two simple websites using the postcards package and the Quarto publishing system.

title: 2  Installation & Setup
text:
For this workshop you need the following:

R, which can be downloaded from the CRAN website.
RStudio, which can be downloaded from the posit.co website.
Quarto, which can be downloaded from the Quarto website.
The postcards and fontawesome R packages.

For this, you can open RStudio and paste the following lines of code in the Console and press enter.

install.packages("postcards")


install.packages("fontawesome")


An account on GitHub.

Finally, it would be good if you had a photo of yourself that you could use for your personal website.

title: 3  Postcards
text:
3.1 Choose a template
The postcards package offers five templates and it would be good to take a moment and which one you’d like to use. Don’t worry, you can always change it later if needed!

Jolla,
Jolla Blue,
Trestles,
Onofre,
Solana.

title: 3  Postcards
text:
3.2 Create the project
In RStudio, click File -> New Project -> New Directory -> Postcards Website
Specify the folder name for your new project, perhaps just postcard and select the template you would like to go with.

title: 3  Postcards
text: 3.3 Update the template In the index.Rmd file, update your name or website title and include a file path to your photo (which should preferably be in the same folder as `index.Rmd). You can also update the URLs. If you would like to use icons for your URLs, you have the following options: 3.3.1 Fontawesome Icons Fontawesome icons can be embedded using the fontawesome package we installed earlier. It can be used for URLs related to email addresses, Twitter, LinkedIn, GitHub. Other icons are available as well, you might want to explore the possibilities by referring to the fontawesome package’s GitHub page Note how you would have to adapt the label field of your template below and adapt it accordingly. - label: '`r fontawesome::fa(name = "envelope", height = "30px")`' url: "mailto:n.moopen@uu.nl" - label: '`r fontawesome::fa(name = "github", height = "30px")`' url: "https://github.com/nehamoopen" - label: '`r fontawesome::fa(name = "twitter", height = "30px")`' url: "https://twitter.com/NehaMoopen" - label: '`r fontawesome::fa(name = "linkedin", height = "30px")`' url: "https://www.linkedin.com/in/neha-moopen/" 3.3.2 Academicons Academicons can also be embedded like Fontawesome icons, but it looks a bit different. This is relevant for icons related to Orcid, Google Scholar, a generic CV and possibly many others. Once again, note how the label needs to be adjusted and adapt it accordingly. - label: url: "https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1412-4402" - label: url: "https://scholar.google.nl/citations?user=q_cH9ZgAAAAJ&hl=en" - label: url: "https://nehamoopen.github.io/CV/" Lastly, to get Academicons to work, you need to include one line of code immediately after the --- in your index.Rmd file. In other words, right after the end of your YAML header/metadata area and right before any text in the body of your document. 3.3.3 Write Write a couple of lines as part of your bio.

title: 3  Postcards
text:
3.4 Render to HTML
When you’re finished, click the Knit button to render to HTML.

title: 4  Quarto
text:
4.1 Create the project
In RStudio, click File -> New Project -> New Directory -> Quarto Website
Specify the folder name for your new project, perhaps just website and create the basic website project.

title: 4  Quarto
text:
4.2 Edit _quarto.yml

Open the _quarto.yml file in RStudio and make some edits:

Set the output-dir in your _quarto.yml file to docs like so:

  type: website
  output-dir: docs


You can update the title of your website and whether you want your navbar menu on left or right-hand side.
Finally, you could choose another theme if you would like.

The default theme is cosmo but you can refer to the Bootswatch website for the other in-built themes available to you. This workshop website is built in Quarto with the pulse theme, for example.

title: 4  Quarto
text:
4.3 Render
Save your changes and click the Render button to create your website. The HTML files for the website should be built and saved in the docs output directory as specified earlier.

title: 4  Quarto
text:
4.4 Add a blog
If you want to add a blog to an existing Quarto website, the following tutorial is a good reference: https://samanthacsik.github.io/posts/2022-10-24-quarto-blogs/
